title: Scaffolding-Based Blended Education Program for Strengthening College Mathematics and Statistics Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level foundational mathematics and statistical knowledge
context.additional_context: Education utilizing interactive platforms accessible in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners achieve basic college-level mathematical and statistical problem-solving skills with over 80% accuracy after 6 months.
Learners acquire the ability to analyze and reconstruct complex mathematical concepts step-by-step through scaffolding techniques.

Learners can establish a 4-week learning plan using metacognitive strategies (learning journaling, goal setting, self-assessment, etc.), achieve ≥80% progress rate relative to the plan based on weekly reflective journals, and attain ≥4 out of 5 points on a final self-assessment report at the course’s conclusion.
Learners complete the process of recognizing and correcting error patterns through a real-time feedback system with over 90% success.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
